quest.name: The Solace of the Sea
journal: Afumi has no patience for seasick pirates.
objectives: Give the medicine to the seasick Doman recruit.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Kami take me! What kind of pirate cannot suffer the sway of the ocean!?

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Hm? A new recruit from far-flung shores? Listen wellâ”€I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Go first to Aokumo below and receive of him medicine for men of the earth.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Then to Quickscape Pier and the hapless Doman bemoaning his wretched fate. Quickly!

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: The wind carries his cries to my ears, and I can stand them no longer. Bring the would-be pirate his medicine!

dialogue.name: AOKUMO
dialogue.text: Come at the behest of Afumi for medicine? My very best is yours for the taking.

dialogue.name: AOKUMO
dialogue.text: How pitiful the lot of this Doman unable to stomach the sea. A true Confederate could raid a dozen ships while in his cups. Mayhap this one should return whence he came.

dialogue.name: AOKUMO
dialogue.text: I have done my part, and you have your medicine. If you tarry, Afumi will hold only you accountable.

dialogue.name: SEASICKNESSMAN2681
dialogue.text: Uuugh... Why does it shift and shudder still...

dialogue.name: SEASICKNESSMAN2681
dialogue.text: Medicines!? Give them here! They may look down on me for resorting to such measures, but I would do aught to render the world stable and motionless once more.

dialogue.name: SEASICKNESSMAN2681
dialogue.text: You are kind, as is Afumi. You may tell her that I will return to my duties as soon as I am able.

dialogue.name: SEASICKNESSMAN2681
dialogue.text: I will not soon forget this kindness. Thank you, my friend, thank you.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: ...The Doman was raised in the mountains of his homeland. The first time he saw the sea was after he fled his homeland and came to us.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: He tosses and turns in his sleep, and when he takes to the water, it is not long before he can no longer stand.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: But he will grow accustomed to this life. He is hardly the first, after all. The captain too was once of Doma, though he cast all aside twenty and five years ago, when the imperials took his lands and the lives of his parents and brothers.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Perhaps you too will renounce your ties and join us someday? Aye, I mistook you for a recruit before, but I know your tale now. Tansui unfolded all.

dialogue.name: AFUMI
dialogue.text: Think on my offer, Westerner. You may find small joys in the land, but the sea holds salvation.
